data.title: Oct – Dec 2018 – Galilee Educational Ministry
data.text:
1, 3, 7, 12, 15 October 2018 – Seek ye first, victorious, Joshua 1:9

I have seriously neglected my Bible study over the last two years and every time I hear Matthew 6:33 – seek ye first the Kingdom of God – it feels like God is reminding me to get back to my studies. To put Him first and foremost. There are a few things that the Lord has explicitly told me to do, which I am seriously neglecting: my quiet time study of His Word and exercising.

The pace of life is so hectic, that our priorities sometimes end up with the most important things at the bottom of the list and more often not getting it done at all.

For months I have been out of routine. I would work through the night and sleep late during the day. Always tired, always stressed. Highly strung.

It is not the life Jesus wants us to live. It is not what He died on the cross for. He died so we may be free from sin, free from stress and to live a life of abundance. Abundance does not necessarily mean plenty of material goods, but instead, it means to be content with whatever God has given us.

The world’s idea of success is money, power and nice things but in the end, none of that will matter. To live peaceably with fellow human beings and with God – yes, when we moan and gripe, we are not at peace with what God has given us – then we are successful. It is a lot easier said than done though. We have hopes, dreams and expectations and when these are not fulfilled, we are hurt and confused and sometimes even angry with God for not giving us the desires of our hearts.

I have learned that when we get to that point, it is time to shift our minds into a different gear. To renew our minds and set it upon all that is lovely, all that God has given – those things we so easily take for granted, like still being alive and able to function – and to focus on verses that tell us how absolutely in LOVE God is with us. The nasty old devil wants to convince us that God is punishing us, but He is not. He loves us and has the best in mind for us. Sometimes He waits to give us the desires of our hearts only when He knows that the timing is right.

But while we wait, we must pour ourselves into His Word and put Him first in all we do. We must Matthew 6:33 every day – But seek ye first the kingdom of God, and his righteousness; and all these things shall be added unto you.

The well-known speaker and life coach Tony Robbins say in one of his seminars: It is not what we do once in a while that brings about change. It is what we do consistently.

We complain with God that we want certain things, yet we fail to consistently seek Him first. I will go as far as saying that many Christians are not good stewards in seeking Him first and this in itself blocks us from receiving “all these things” that shall be added unto us. I am not saying that it is the only reason why God will sometimes withhold gifts to us, but it certainly is one of the reasons because He does not want us to have idols in our hearts and when we put anything before Him, then it is an idol.

While I am typing this, the Fireproof song by John Waller – While I am waiting – comes to mind. While we wait on God, we must keep on seeking Him first in all we do.

While I’m Waiting – John Waller

I’m waiting, I’m waiting on You Lord

And I am hopeful, I’m waiting on You Lord

Though it is painful, but patiently I will wait

And I will move ahead bold and confident

Taking every step in obedience

While I’m waiting I will serve You

While I’m waiting I will worship

While I’m waiting I will not faint

I’ll be running the race even while I wait

I’m waiting, I’m waiting on You Lord

And I am peaceful, I’m waiting on You Lord

Though it’s not easy no, but faithfully I will wait

Yes, I will wait

And I will move ahead bold and confident

Taking every step in obedience

While I’m waiting I will serve You

While I’m waiting I will worship

While I’m waiting I will not faint

I’ll be running the race even while I wait

I will move ahead bold and confident

I’ll be taking every step in obedience, yeah

While I’m waiting I will serve You

While I’m waiting I will worship

While I’m waiting I will not faint

And I will serve You while I’m waiting

I will worship while I’m waiting

I will serve You while I’m waiting

I will worship while I’m waiting

I will serve You while I’m waiting

I will worship while I’m waiting on You Lord

I will serve You while I’m waiting

I will worship while I’m waiting

I will serve You while I’m waiting

I will worship while I’m waiting

The word victor popped up in a song – I did not catch the name or artist – and I was again reminded that no matter how much I might feel like a failure in this world, through Christ we are more than conquerors. We are victorious overcomers. The battle was won when Jesus died and rose again. And in Christ, we have the victory.

Just after that Ray Legodi on Radio Pulpit quoted Joshua 1:9 in which God tells us to take courage. Just like Joshua inherited the land of Canaan, the Christians will inherit the Kingdom of God.

2 October 2018 – Faithful in the small things, see what God is doing

Waiting long for God’s promises to be fulfilled, sometimes has a tendency to make us blunt. Despondent. Yet, we have to run the race flat out and remain faithful even in the small things before God can entrust bigger things to us. The Lord has reminded me of this, throughout 2018. And several times in the last few years. On this day, it came through Christine Ferreira’s discussion with Ronel Bezuidenhout on Radio Pulpit.

The message for the day, on our youth group, contained the same message.

Furthermore, the Word for Today was about seeing what God is doing in our lives. It refers to Moses and how God called him from the burning bush. It also encourages us to not miss God’s calling on our lives. He would often, out of the blue (or a burning bush) call us on a specific day and our lives will change forever.

But we have to pay attention, or we may miss it. It is one of the very important reasons I keep a diary.

3 October 2018 – Listening for God’s voice

The Word for Today is about listening for God’s voice.

Many people believe that God stopped talking to His children and that the only way He now talks to us, is through the Bible. However, I completely disagree with this.

The Bible teaches us that God is the same yesterday, today and forever. Furthermore, the Lord spoke to the very first man, woman and child on earth thousands of years ago. And for thousands of years after, He continued to speak to mankind.

There is a period between the books of Malachi and Matthew where it appears as though God did not speak to His people and many sermons are preached on this.

With this also, I do not agree. It cannot be proved that God did not speak to anyone during that time. I think that God spoke to individuals, but no one was instructed to record anything He said or perhaps it was recorded, but it was nothing God wanted to preserve for us today.

Besides God speaking in the Old Testament and through Jesus while He lived on earth, there are also referrals of the Holy Spirit speaking in the New Testament.

Luke 12:12 for the Holy Spirit will teach you in that very hour what you ought to say.”

Act 8:29 And the Spirit said to Philip, “Go over and join this chariot.”

Act 10:19 And while Peter was pondering the vision, the Spirit said to him, “Behold, three men are looking for you.

Act 11:12 And the Spirit told me to go with them, making no distinction. These six brothers also accompanied me, and we entered the man’s house.

Act 11:28 And one of them named Agabus stood up and foretold by the Spirit that there would be a great famine over all the world (this took place in the days of Claudius).

Act 13:2 While they were worshiping the Lord and fasting, the Holy Spirit said, “Set apart for me Barnabas and Saul for the work to which I have called them.”

Act 20:23 except that the Holy Spirit testifies to me in every city that imprisonment and afflictions await me.

Act 21:4 And having sought out the disciples, we stayed there for seven days. And through the Spirit they were telling Paul not to go on to Jerusalem.

Act 21:11 And coming to us, he took Paul’s belt and bound his own feet and hands and said, “Thus says the Holy Spirit, ‘This is how the Jews at Jerusalem will bind the man who owns this belt and deliver him into the hands of the Gentiles.’”

1Ti 4:1 Now the Spirit expressly says that in later times some will depart from the faith by devoting themselves to deceitful spirits and teachings of demons,

Rev 2:7 He who has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches. To the one who conquers I will grant to eat of the tree of life, which is in the paradise of God.’

Rev 2:11 He who has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches. The one who conquers will not be hurt by the second death.’

Rev 2:17 He who has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches. To the one who conquers I will give some of the hidden manna, and I will give him a white stone, with a new name written on the stone that no one knows except the one who receives it.’

Rev 2:29 He who has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches.’

Rev 3:6 He who has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches.’

Rev 3:13 He who has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches.’

Rev 3:22 He who has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches.’”

Rev 14:13 And I heard a voice from heaven saying, “Write this: Blessed are the dead who die in the Lord from now on.” “Blessed indeed,” says the Spirit, “that they may rest from their labors, for their deeds follow them!”

Rev 22:17 The Spirit and the Bride say, “Come.” And let the one who hears say, “Come.” And let the one who is thirsty come; let the one who desires take the water of life without price.

Rom 8:16 The Spirit himself bears witness with our spirit that we are children of God,

From the verses above it is clear that the Holy Spirit, who was sent by the Father as Jesus said He would be, speaks to us and will keep on speaking to us. The Bible says that He speaks – it is not a mime show where the Holy Spirit is present but we do not hear Him.

Some of those who do not believe that the Holy Spirit still speaks to us, have a tendency to think it is mostly Charismatic types that experience Him speaking, however, that is not true. Many Christians across all denominations report on hearing the voice of the Holy Spirit.

I agree that there is much deception and some people are hearing voices other than that of the Holy Spirit. That is why it is so important to be in the Word of God as much as possible and to trust God for discernment.

Dr. Michelle Strydom gives extensive teaching on how evil forces communicate with people through theta brainwave activity. She further explains how to discern the source of the communication we receive. We should discern the source of all communication, whether it is internal or external such as another person, or any form of media. Because other forms of communication can also be inspired by evil forces, though they may come across as pure and from God.

It is a very fine line.

Jesus said: “Not everyone who says to me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ will enter the kingdom of heaven, but the one who does the will of my Father who is in heaven. On that day many will say to me, ‘Lord, Lord, did we not prophesy in your name, and cast out demons in your name, and do many mighty works in your name? And then will I declare to them, ‘I never knew you; depart from me, you workers of lawlessness.’

Also, Proverbs 14:12 states that there is a way that looks right to a man, but its end is destruction. “ There is a way that seems right to a man, but its end is the way to death.”

Therefore, I can not emphasize enough, how important discernment is.

Our spirit should always testify alongside the Holy Spirit and when we feel uneasy in our spirit because something goes against God’s Word, we should adhere to it and react accordingly.

That, in turn, is why it is vital to STUDY God’s Word. Systematically. Reading a verse here and there does not supply the sustenance one needs for healthy spiritual living and knowledge of the Word. Out of my nine years of Bible study, five of those were done chronologically and it has helped me immensely to retain information. When I started chronologically studying the Bible, it suddenly came alive. The boredom of Kings and Chronicles with the many names and genealogies became interesting and realistic. Reading the Bible from book to book was confusing. King David was alive, then he passed away, then he wrote a psalm. When studying chronologically, the life of David was followed as it progressed, with the psalms he wrote, in between.

Every Christian should read the Bible chronologically, at least once in a lifetime. My chronological list of the Old Testament is below this, should you wish to download it. It must be read left to right, from top to bottom. I marked off every section after finishing it, so I did not get confused.

Chronological Order of The Bible – Old Testament

In addition to studying the Bible chronologically, I also make notes on a sheet of topics I wish to study for example when John 3:16 came up, I would make a note and number it to study the word “love” and all its aspects. From E-sword I would pull all verses containing the word love and I would study the various Greek formats of that word. I would make a note to study the word “begotten” and add a number to it. Then I would note the word “whosoever” and study all aspects of that.

It is a slow study process but it is thorough and very rewarding.

During these studies, the Lord has spoken to me a lot through His Word. He has given me a lot of revelation and often news and other events would apply to sections that I was busy studying at that time.

4, 5, 12 October 2018 – Washing of water by the Word, renew our thoughts, heart of flesh, Don’t Try to Force It

Ephesians 5:25 – 27 says “Husbands, love your wives, even as Christ also loved the church, and gave Himself for it; that He might sanctify and cleanse it with the washing of water by the word,

that He might present it to Himself a glorious church, not having spot, or wrinkle, or any such thing; but that it should be holy and without blemish.”

The part “washing of water by the Word” came up several times this week and Holy Spirit pointed it out to me. Also to renew our minds, as well as the verse that God will take out the heart of stone and give a heart of flesh came up several times.

The Lord reaffirmed once again that we can not renew our thoughts unless we study His Word. Taking in the Word is what cleanses us and renews our minds. Failing to do so will result in the exact opposite and the danger of people drifting away and getting weak in the faith. Especially with the times we live in, it is most crucial to be grounded in the Word of God.

Not only as individuals but as congregations and it is important for teachers to teach pure Biblical doctrine for the church to remain sanctified and cleansed.

The Word for Today of 5 October was yet again a powerful message very applicable to myself. Having waited so long for things to happen in my life, I tend to sometimes want to force them to happen instead of just letting God do it in His perfect time.

5, 6, 9, 10, 11, 14 October 2018 – Ruth

Over several days, the name Ruth came up numerous times and my attention was drawn to it.

I felt as though God was calling my name. Calling me to attention.

On the 5th, I turned the Book of Ruth on for bedtime. I very often have the audio Bible playing quietly while I sleep. Though I am not cognitively processing the information, I believe that my mind still takes it in.

This specific night I felt like listening to the Book of Ruth. I do not often listen to it, but this night I chose her story.

On the 6th on Radio Pulpit, Berni Dymet’s insert was about Ruth. The part where she insisted on staying with Naomi and how God blessed her for honoring her mother-in-law.

On the 9th Joyce Meyer said in her insert over Radio Pulpit: “where are the Esthers and the Ruths?”

During the sermon on the 14th, mention was made of the obedience of Ruth and what we learn from that.

On the 10th I noted a few significant numbers and parallels that I picked up about my life:

My calling happens in 2019 and in this year it is

7 years since God showed me what my calling is. Seven is the number of perfection.

My mother was born in 1949, which means she would have turned 70 this year

It is 10 years since her passing away

Vanderbijlpark, the town that I have lived in for the most part of my time in the Vaal Triangle, was established in 1949 – the same year as my mother’s birth year and also 70 years ago.

I have been staying in the Vaal Triangle for 21 years – which is what was considered adulthood/maturity for many years in the past – before it was changed to the age of 18 in South Africa.

I could not help getting the feeling that God had orchestrated all this as a means of showing me that indeed my time has come.

On the 11th I picked up on Radio Pulpit, but I did not note who said it, the verse which says that my times are in God’s hands. I considered that as the confirmation of God’s planning of my life.

I also noted that the theme the entire week was about overcoming fear, to trust God, to forgive and to renew my mind.

8 October 2018 – Strength for Speakers

This day’s Word for Today is an encouraging message for those who address large scores of people. I made a point of remembering the phrase “ you can’t fill an empty bucket from a dry well”

It is important to always stay tapped-in into the Word of God. Pun intended.

9, 10 October 2018 – Doulos, Amos 3:7, representatives

On these two days, the word doulos appeared twice and Holy Spirit pointed it out to me with a friendly reminder to always have a servant’s heart.

Also, Holy Spirit again pointed out Amos 3:7 – Surely the Lord GOD will do nothing, but He revealeth His secret unto His servants the prophets.

Also, Fanie Coetzer’s insert on Radio Pulpit referred to us representing God and His DNA here on earth.

https://www.galileeministry.co.za/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/Daybreak-101018.mp3

14, 15 October 2018 – Understanding our Heavenly Father

Seeing God as our Father is beautifully explained in this two-part piece from Word for Today.

16 October 2018 – Your talents

On this afternoon, Tania Strauss’ insert specifically referred to how we manage our lives and our talents. The part that stood out for me was “talents”.

Again I felt like God was prompting me to apply one of the beautiful talents He had given to my entire family: music.

Singing is my forté and what I like doing most. I have not played piano in many years and I know I need to pick up on it again, soon.

As for singing, I knew I had to sing something soon, just to get started. No matter how out of practice I am, I just had to get it done. I needed to break the ice, since 2012 when I stopped singing.

23 October 2018 – Wake up South Africa, wake up!

Just as I woke this morning, the following words gripped my heart: Wake up South Africa, wake up!

I felt God saying that South Africans had to open up their eyes to the deceit that was going on all around, even in churches and false Christianity.

1 November 2018 – Do not want to ask anymore

On this day, I wanted to ask God for something – a desire of my heart – but I just felt that I did not even want to ask for anything anymore out of fear that the answer would again be “no” or “wait”.

But immediately Holy Spirit brought to remembrance the parable of the widow who kept on nagging and nagging the judge until he conceded to her request.

Keep asking and keep trusting. God’s word is for real and His promises true. It will happen if He said so.

2 November 2018 – Knowing God’s will is powerful

The Word for Today’s bit was about Knowing God’s Will and how powerful it is.

To this, I can testify wholeheartedly. Since God revealed His calling upon my life in 2012, I have been able to cope better with the issues of this life. It is still difficult sometimes, but God is not a man that He should lie. What He says He will do, He does.

7 November 2018 – CCMA, freedom, reconcile, settle the matter and Stradivarius

My CCMA case’s final hearing was on this day. I did not sleep well, was tired and overwhelmed.

On Radio Pulpit, some of Johann Els very first words were: “come now, let us settle the matter” as in Isaiah 1:18 (NIV).

A little later, Johann said that I have the peace of reconciliation and he also referred to being “declared innocent”.

The Word for Today was referring to being free from religious bondage and the word free and freedom came up several times on this day.

Gustav Gouws on Radio Pulpit after that used the word reconciliation and freedom.

After that Janine and Wynand were talking about Stradivari and how they produced their Stradivarius instruments. How the beaten up wood, produced a beautiful sound.

That hit my heart with a loud thud. If they spoke of it on any other day, it would have been different. But on this day, where I wanted my innocence proven, it meant a lot to me. It reminded me of my calling, as a late bloomer and all of God’s promises to me.

After that, a young man named Henko spoke of his testimony and my ear caught the part where he said: I just had peace. Peace comes with reconciliation.

After that Psalm 105:7 came up:

Psalm 105:17 – He sent a man before them, even Joseph, who was sold for a servant:

Psalm 105:17 Hy het ‘n man voor hulle uit gestuur: Josef is as slaaf verkoop.

When I hear the story of Joseph, it reminds me so much of my own story. The very big dreams God had for him, the unbelief and envy of his brothers, the hardship it took to get to his calling and the time that it took to get there.

I set out to Vereeniging for my CCMA case, sure and confident that I will win. After all, I have truth and all God’s promises on my side.

https://www.galileeministry.co.za/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/Daybreak-071118.mp3

8 November 2018 – You must know your life’s purpose

In this Word for Today, it is made clear how important it is to know your life’s purpose to do what God requires from you. Not knowing, will result in likely doing the wrong things.

10 November 2018 – Work as though unto the Lord, God is your provider

On this day, Janine van Niekerk on Radio Pulpit was talking about how employees should protect employers’ interest by working diligently as though working unto the Lord. Since being born again, this has always been my motto. Even though my employer does not see what I do during work hours, God sees. Am I honoring God with my work?

Many Christians spend way too much time on social media for personal matters daily during work hours – which is stealing company time. And God clearly says in His Ten Commandments that we may not steal.

I am confident that when I stand before God, this is one aspect on which I will be rewarded. I take work very seriously and give my best.

Often throughout our lives, it seems as though things do not work out the way we want them to.

Many of the figures in the Bible had the same problem. However, Romans 8:28 cannot be any clearer: “And we know that for those who love God all things work together for good, for those who are called according to his purpose.”

This was the message by The Word for Today.

At the time I did not know how much I will be leaning on that scripture and this message from God in the days that followed.

13 November 2018 – Get real with God

It amazes me how I and many other Christians that I am aware of, sometimes think God does not see or know the deepest motivations of our hearts. He knows everything, we can hide nothing.

This Word for Today is a stark reminder of this and a call to some serious self-examination.

[clear]

16 November 2018 – Family who do not talk

I was upset with my sister, for not reacting to any of my messages and I blocked her on Whatsapp. But the conviction to unblock her was too great to resist. I unblocked her and when we spoke, she gave me shocking news – but only a tiny portion of it.

I did not have the full picture until January 2019.

https://www.galileeministry.co.za/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/Brandpunt-16-Nov-2018-Restoring-Family-Ties.mp3

17, 18 November 2018 – Doorn Créche and God’s Bloomin’ Message

Special spiritual occasions are noted in my diary and I celebrate them each year. This year, the 17th of November was the first celebration of my going to Doorn Créche and being delivered of a lifetime of bondage.

The 18th was the first year that I celebrated God’s Blooming message to me, which was kicked off by Pastor Peter at church.

19, 21 November 2018 – 2017 Prophecy over SA by Dr Jonathan David

On the 19th of November, I received a prophecy from Bulelani of New Nation Movement but only listened to it on the 21st.

This prophecy was given in November 2016.

The prophecy was by Dr Jonathan David and it contained the following info as in the audio and typed up below:

https://www.galileeministry.co.za/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/Prophecy-over-South-Africa-2017-REDUCED.mp3

Point 1 – Peoples Movement

Company of people across the world will come together

The rise of a new people movement inspired by the Holy Ghost (perhaps New Nation Movement?)

A new dimension that is causing all nationalities to come together

5 Things concerning South Africa

An inspired prayer movement that will take place – all nationalities will partake (It’s Time?)

Africa is going to change

God is going to cause South Africa to be the inspiration in the heart of the Africa continent

He refers to Cape Hope (it reminded me of Fire Trails in 2010 – a movement brought to life by Elza Meyer. At the start of this prayer campaign, three arrows were shot from Table Mountain in the Cape of Good Hope Northward symbolically into into Africa. One arrow for the East, one for the West and one for the centre of Africa. Someone recently mentioned trains that went in those directions. I do not recall the trains, but I do recall that teams went out in each direction, visiting towns on its path).

Spirit lead people rising

United by the cause for the Lord, God is leading the movement – no human leader. (The word Theocracy has come up several times in the last few years and my understanding of that is that God will raise up leaders, in the same way He rose the Judges in Biblical times. A Theocracy is the opposite of a Democracy where people vote. In a Theocracy people do not vote as in a democracy as it – a Theocracy – is similar to a kingdom and in this case Jesus will be the King. Theocracy is derived from the Greek word, which means God in the same way as Theology means “study of God”.)

God is calling all peoples in unity in Him

God will bring covenant breakers into judgment

Spirit lead appointment centered people movement in South Africa

Point 2 – Prayer

Holy Spirit will create tremendous power of prayer

No weapons of war, but the weapon of prayer

In many nations of Africa

The people of South Africa will pursue the same purpose and be committed to each other

There will be no fear

Point 3 – Violence will be stopped

A transformation will happen, without guns

The cursed ground will be changed

He speaks of a prayer meeting of one million people where the sound has a three minutes delay – all of heaven responds and all of hell trembles

Evil strongholds will be brought down in cities

God is going to do an amazing work – terror won’t come by night, everyone will have a share

Point 4 – Streams will merge into a river, churches will change

Hardest one to happen, there are men standing in high place in the spiritual kingdom in churches who are trying to prevent this from happening, but God will remove them one by one.

2017 is the year of God’s government coming into South Africa

Denomination lines will break, the common denominator will be the indwelling Holy Spirit

There will be a lot resistance in churches saying it is politics, but this is church, but the righteous will be chosen, the Christian concensus will take over to bring the victory

From now until the election in 2019 the gap has to be breached

South Africa almost the last nation to come into the race (a late bloomer)

Find your lost brother, South African revival is about to break out, the minds of people are going to change

Let’s set the house in order

This revival is amazing because God will rise from the inside

He will deal swiftly with the Godless

Something supernatural is going to happen

South Africa is going to be a model for Africa and other places

Light will be coming slowly from South Africa and spread all the way

Point 5 – God will hold the currency

This is my Proverbs 1:14, 15 testimony of 2012 – throw in your lot among us; we will all have one purse”— my son, do not walk in the way with them; hold back your foot from their paths,”. South Africa will not partake in the global one world currency, but of God’s currency.

The economy of this country will grow steadier and steadier, unexplained. God is the God of the currencies.

The currency of the South African is a people’s movement based on prayer, they will turn their weapons of war into agritural equipment (My testimony of 2014 of Isaiah 2:4, 5 – He shall judge between the nations, and shall decide disputes for many peoples; and they shall beat their swords into plowshares, and their spears into pruning hooks; nation shall not lift up sword against nation, neither shall they learn war anymore. O house of Jacob, come, let us walk in the light of the LORD.)

The movement that will start, will be co-ordinated by the Holy Spirit to unite men and women

Your days of waiting is coming to an end, the day of the answer is coming (my 2018 testimony of February = 06 + 05 + 08 = 19)

This is not the time to run away or be afraid

God will push back the spirit of darkness, no weapen against us will prosper

The Word of the Lord will go forth and all the nations of the world will listen

The way God will do it so quickly, that their hope will rise in all of Africa (my Habakkuk 2:3 testimony of December 2015 under the James Bond – Spectre heading: “For still the vision awaits its appointed time; it hastens to the end–it will not lie. If it seems slow, wait for it; it will surely come; it will not delay.” When it happens, it will happen quickly and suddenly)

South Africa must rise, God is giving priority to this nation, your time has come

The kingdoms of the world will become the Kingdom of our Christ and He will reign forever

The church has a major role

God will make it up to Africa (Joel 2:25 – “I will restore to you the years that the swarming locust has eaten, the hopper, the destroyer, and the cutter, my great army, which I sent among you.” During my study of the Old Testament, when I came to this verse, I experienced the Lord telling me that as a late bloomer, I must not look at the years lost, for He will restore it. In my 2015 testimony with the heading “Also in 2015 – Africa’s stunted growth” I experienced that, like me, Africa should not look at the years lost, for the Lord will restore it.)

Prayer will be restored in schools, Bibles will be handed out freely

20 November 2018 – Leader, here’s God’s way

The Word for Today on this day was giving valuable advice on delegating tasks and not doing it all single-handedly.

22 November 2018 – You will get back more than you give, LOST!!!

On this morning, I received a notification of the outcome of my CCMA case. The decision was in favour of the employee.

I lost my case.

I was devastated. Something inside me broke.

But I knew I had to look beyond the here and now and keep on trusting God, no matter what.

However, it gets difficult at times to keep on failing and failing and failing at everything. Proverbs 13:12 says – “Hope deferred makes the heart sick, but a desire fulfilled is a tree of life.”

There are days that my heart feels like it is in ICU.

On this day, the Word for Today mentions that we will get more than we give. Even though I feel now like I am losing at EVERYTHING, I hold on to the promises of God and I know He will give me more than I give and make up for all my losses.

23 November 2018 – Trust God’s unchanging character

After receiving the outcome of my CCMA case, I felt devastated. When I read the Word for Today, I felt that it was God’s way of telling me to trust His decision and to trust Him completely.

In the days that followed, I was crying to God: why, Lord? I was so sure I would win my case because You gave me Deuteronomy 28:7 that my enemies will flee before me, so many times.

26 November 2018 – Give thanks to God in all circumstances, The Napalm Girl

This morning on Pulpit, Joyce Meyer was saying that we are to stop murmuring and to thank God in everything, no matter what the circumstances. To give thanks to God and not

This morning on Pulpit, Joyce Meyer was saying that we are to stop murmuring and to thank God in everything, no matter what the circumstances. To give thanks to God and not take people for granted.

Just after that was Focus on the Family and the team had an interview with Kim Phuc, a Vietnamese woman whose village was bombed in 1972 by the Vietnamese government when she was a young girl. The bombs contained a substance called napalm, which burns the skin when it comes into contact with it. Almost like acid would.

I remember as a child, seeing the award-winning picture of Kim Phuc, dubbed The Napalm Girl, as she was running naked through the street, while her skin was being burned by the napalm. At that time I was roughly the same age as she was when it happened and the memory of this stuck in my mind to this very day.

After hearing her testimony, I Googled her and thanks to Wikipedia for the info posted below.

During her interview with Focus, she was telling of the constant pain that she still endured from the burns, as well as the numerous operations she has had and still had to have.

Despite that, she turned to Christianity and is serving God with her whole being.

She gives thanks to God in everything and has a platform for sharing her faith.

We so easily gripe and complain – I often battle with complaints. Then I try to remind myself of Paul and Silas singing praises to God at midnight, after having been beaten and in pain and in chains in prison.

Many Christians of this day, specifically in Western cultures, do not face persecution nearly this bad. Yet we are quick to complain about how unfair life is, our faith is fickle and rests on circumstances of the moment, rather than what Jesus has done for us and that He is coming back to get us for eternity.

It is in the most trying times that I discovered how strong my faith really is. Sometimes I would have doubts and be filled with fear, but God would pick me up and renew my strength and He ALWAYS comes through for me at His good time.

We should pray the Lord to give us faith in abundance for the time of persecution is coming. And we should learn to trust Him fully. That in turn, makes it much easier to give thanks at all times.

28 November 2018 – Now I know why, Get up and try again

For almost ten years, it had bothered me that I was not at my mother’s bed when she passed away. I had gone to the front door to have a cigarette (during my smoking days). I was not looking at the clock at that time and had no idea how late it was.

Standing at the front door, the hooters, crackers and cheering people increased and I realised that it was midnight. I flicked away the cigarette and ran to my mother’s room, to find that she had just breathed out her last. I walked over to her and closed her eyes – it had just happened.

At midnight, just as God said it would.

Had I been in the room at that time, I would have focused on my mother and would not have noticed the time and that she passed away right at midnight as God said. So for the first time in ten years, I had peace about not having been right there when it happened.
